Russia unleashes biggest-ever air barrage on Ukraine, hits government complex
subhead: This was the first time a government building had been hit in the over three-year-long war. President Volodymyr Zelensky said he was counting on a strong US response shortly after Donald Trump said he might impose more sanctions on Moscow.

title: Alcaraz beats Sinner to win US Open and reclaim No.1 ranking
subhead: The 22-year-old won 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 to capture his second US Open crown and sixth Grand Slam title, avenging his lone defeat in a major final by Sinner at Wimbledon in July.

title: Tradition done right: Five Paris restaurants reimagining the classics
subhead: Are you a fan of French cuisine classics such as 'œufs en meurette' (poached eggs in red wine sauce), 'navarin d'agneau' [lamb stew] and apple tart? Discover our selection of five Paris restaurants that awaken both the appetite and a sense of nostalgia.

title: 'Access to pornography gravely undermines children's mental health and psychological integrity'
subhead: Feminist figures from 17 European countries call for the implementation of age verification on pornographic websites. They see it as a necessary measure to protect the most vulnerable audiences from content that is often violent, misogynistic, racist or even contains child sexual abuse.

title: Isabelle Adjani's puzzling career, from disappearances to spectacular comebacks
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (6/6). Since the success of 'L'Eté Meurtrier' ('One Deadly Summer') in 1983, the actress has continually alternated between periods of intense activity and long breaks. If her career is hard to decipher, its diverse output attests to her genius for the trade.

title: Did Macron really add €1 trillion to France's national debt?
subhead: While this figure often cited by opposition parties is misleading, France's debt has risen significantly under Emmanuel Macron's presidency, partly due to his tax policy decisions.

title: 'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.
